intro: Lavoisiera cogniauxiana, commonly known as the Cogniaux's lavoisiera, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
